alert.note: Alert for McKinley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 19 at 4:59AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central New Mexico, including the following county, McKinley. * WHEN...Until 800 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 455 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving slowly north across the Interstate 40 corridor between Gallup and Lupton. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. The heaviest rain has fallen around Manuelito. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gallup, Manuelito, Rock Springs, Yah-Ta-Hey, Tse Bonito, Mentmore, Allison, Gamerco and Red Rock State Park. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 1 and 23, Reservation Roads 7043 and 7046, County Road 1, and State Roads 118 and 602. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
